channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023100751
item.description:
Report E-2023100751

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While moving a pallet of batteries with a forklift over a containment berm to be loaded onto a trailer, the plastic bands binding the batteries to the pallet broke. This caused 2 batteries to fall off of the pallet and crack. 1 gallon of battery acid released onto the containment floor. Veolia neutralized the spilled battery acid and conducted cleanup in house.

item.title: Report X-2023100184

Report X-2023100184

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully regulated package came to QA soiled due to a loose cap on one of the bottles. DescribePack: Loose cap allowed liquid to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in tote and brought to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023100170
item.description:
Report X-2023100170

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was been unloaded when they notice the box was kind wet from one of the coroners so they brought the package over to QA so QA can inspect the Package and start the process on it DescribePack: The cap was loose on the gallon that what caused the leakage on the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was but in a bag and bucket and brought straight to QA
